Package com.gemalto.idp.mobile.qr.emv.exception

Class EmvException

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Throwable
java.lang.Exception
com.gemalto.idp.mobile.qr.emv.exception.EmvException
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class EmvException extends Exception
Exception that is thrown when decoding operation fails (see EmvDecoder.decode(String)).
Since:
5.0
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final int
    ERR_CODE_DATA_OBJECT_DUPLICATE
    Indicates violation of EMVCo requirement 4.3.1.2: There shall be only one occurrence of a data object with a specific ID under the root and there shall be only one occurrence of a specific ID within a template.
    static final int
    ERR_CODE_DATA_OBJECT_INCOMPLETE
    Indicates that a data object in the input is incomplete (value is truncated).
    static final int
    ERR_CODE_DATA_OBJECT_MISSING
    Indicates that referenced mandatory data object is missing in the input.
    static final int
    ERR_CODE_DATA_OBJECT_NOT_FOUND
    Indicates that a data object structure (ID-Length-Value) was not identified in the input data.
    static final int
    ERR_CODE_DATA_OBJECT_REDUNDANT
    Indicates that a data object is redundant (there is another object already present).
    static final int
    ERR_CODE_DATA_OBJECT_UNEXPECTED
    Indicates that an unexpected data object was encountered (see cause for details).
    static final int
    ERR_CODE_INCORRECT_CRC
    Indicates that the CRC value is incorrect.
    static final int
    ERR_CODE_INVALID_DATA_OBJECT_FORMAT
    Indicates that the given data object has invalid format (see cause for details).
    static final int
    ERR_CODE_INVALID_END_OF_QR_CODE
    Indicates that the QR code does not end with a 16bit CRC - i.e.
    static final int
    ERR_CODE_INVALID_START_OF_QR_CODE
    Indicates that the QR code data does not start with correct Payload Format Indicator value - i.e.

  • Field Details

    • ERR_CODE_INVALID_START_OF_QR_CODE

      public static final int ERR_CODE_INVALID_START_OF_QR_CODE
      Indicates that the QR code data does not start with correct Payload Format Indicator value - i.e. probably not an EMVCo QR Code
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • ERR_CODE_INVALID_END_OF_QR_CODE

      public static final int ERR_CODE_INVALID_END_OF_QR_CODE
      Indicates that the QR code does not end with a 16bit CRC - i.e. probably not an EMVCo QR Code
      See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • EmvException

      public EmvException(String message, int errorCode, Throwable cause)
      Creates a new EmvException object.
      Parameters:
      message - Error message.
      errorCode - Error code.
      cause - Original cause of the error.

  • Method Details

    • getErrorCode

      public int getErrorCode()
      Provides a numeric error code, which can be used to handle specific errors programmatically.
      Returns:
      An integer error code corresponding to one of the constants in EmvException class.

    • getErrorDetails

      public String getErrorDetails()
      Provides a detailed message about the error with an internal cause.
      Returns:
      A multiline detailed error message.
